title: Aloo Posto
instructions: Soak poppy seeds in water for 30 minutes and grind with green chilies to a paste.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and temper with kalonji.
Add diced potatoes and sauté for 5-6 minutes.
Add poppy seed paste, salt, and a little water.
Cook covered until potatoes are soft and coated with the paste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Shukto
instructions: Heat mustard oil and fry bitter gourd slices lightly. Remove and keep aside.
Temper oil with mustard seeds and radhuni.
Add chopped vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Add mustard paste, ginger paste, salt, and sugar.
Add water and cook till vegetables are tender.
Add milk (if using) and simmer briefly.
Add fried bitter gourd and serve hot.

title: Lau Ghonto
ingredients: 1 medium bottle gourd, grated or finely chopped
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until golden (if using). Boil till soft.
Heat mustard oil and add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and green chilies.
Add bottle gourd, turmeric, and salt. Cook covered till soft.
Add cooked moong dal and mix well.
Sprinkle grated coconut and serve with rice.

title: Kumro Chokka
instructions: Heat mustard oil and add panch phoron and dried red chili.
Add pumpkin, turmeric, salt, and cook covered till soft.
Add boiled kala chana and mix well.
Add sugar and simmer till slightly dry.
Serve with luchi or rice.

title: Aloo Begun Jhol
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add cumin seeds and green chili.
Add potatoes and eggplant. Fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add turmeric and salt, sauté briefly.
Add tomatoes and water. Cover and cook till veggies are soft.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Chorchori
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add panch phoron and red chili.
Add all vegetables, turmeric, and salt.
Mix and cook covered on low heat until soft.
Uncover and cook till slightly dry.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Jhinge Aloo Posto
instructions: Soak and grind poppy seeds with green chilies.
Heat mustard oil, add kalonji.
Add potatoes and ridge gourd, sauté for 5 minutes.
Add poppy seed paste and salt, cook covered till veggies are soft.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Jharkhandi Dubki Kadhi
instructions: Mix besan with salt, turmeric, ajwain, and water to make a thick batter.
Fry spoonfuls of batter to make pakoras.
Whisk yogurt with besan, turmeric, salt, and water.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin, and red chili for tempering.
Add yogurt mixture, bring to a boil, then simmer.
Add pakoras and cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Kaddu ki Sabzi (Bihari style)
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add panch phoron.
Add pumpkin, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and sugar.
Cook covered with a little water until soft.
Mash lightly and cook till dry.
Serve with poori or paratha.

title: Bihari Aloo Bharta
instructions: Mash boiled potatoes thoroughly.
Add chopped green chilies, onion, salt, and mustard oil.
Mix well and garnish with coriander leaves if using.
Serve with rice and dal.

title: Ghugni
instructions: Soak white peas overnight and boil until soft.
Heat oil, sauté onion and green chili until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, turmeric, cumin powder, and salt. Cook till oil separates.
Add boiled peas and water. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with puri or bread.

title: Parwal Aloo Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add cumin seeds and green chili.
Add onion, sauté until soft. Add tomato and cook till mushy.
Add turmeric, salt, parwal, and potato. Mix well.
Add water, cover and cook till vegetables are tender.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Santula
instructions: Boil all vegetables with a pinch of salt till soft. Drain and keep aside.
Heat oil, add panch phoron and green chili.
Add ginger paste, sauté briefly, then add boiled vegetables.
Toss gently, cook for 2-3 minutes, and serve warm.

title: Dahi Baingan
instructions: Fry eggplant slices until golden. Set aside.
Whisk yogurt with salt and turmeric.
Heat oil, temper with mustard and cumin seeds, and green chili.
Add yogurt and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Add fried eggplant, mix gently, and cook for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

title: Dalma
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (raw banana, pumpkin, papaya, brinjal)
instructions: Boil dal and vegetables with turmeric and salt until soft.
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds and red chilies.
Add ginger paste and sauté briefly.
Pour this tempering into the dal-vegetable mix.
Add grated coconut and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Saag Bhaja
ingredients: 2 cups leafy greens (spinach, amaranth, or mustard greens), chopped
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds and red chili.
Add chopped garlic and sauté till golden.
Add leafy greens and salt. Stir-fry till wilted and dry.
Serve as a side dish with rice and dal.

title: Khar
ingredients: 1/4 tsp baking soda (substitute for traditional khar)
instructions: Boil papaya with baking soda and salt until tender.
Heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds and red chili.
Add boiled papaya, stir and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Aloo Pitika
instructions: Mash boiled potatoes in a bowl.
Add chopped onion, green chili, salt, and mustard oil.
Mix well. Garnish with coriander if desired.
Serve with rice and dal.

title: Kosha Kumro
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add panch phoron and dried red chili.
Add pumpkin, turmeric, sugar, and salt.
Cook covered until soft, stir occasionally.
Uncover and sauté until dry.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Lau Shukto
instructions: Lightly fry bitter gourd and set aside.
Heat mustard oil, add radhuni and sauté ginger paste.
Add bottle gourd, salt, sugar, and water. Cook till tender.
Add mustard paste and milk, simmer briefly.
Add fried bitter gourd and cook 2-3 minutes more.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Bengali Paneer Curry (Chanar Dalna)
instructions: Fry paneer and potatoes until golden and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onion and ginger paste.
Add tomato, turmeric, cumin powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add potatoes and water. Cook until soft.
Add paneer, garam masala, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Chanar Kalia
instructions: Fry paneer until golden and set aside.
Heat ghee, add bay leaf and chopped onion. Sauté till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and cook till oil separates.
Add tomato puree and salt. Cook well.
Add water, bring to a boil, add paneer, and simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Finish with garam masala. Serve with pulao or rice.

title: Paneer Ghugni
ingredients: 1 cup dried white peas, soaked and boiled
instructions: Fry paneer lightly and keep aside.
Heat oil, sauté onion, green chili, and ginger paste.
Add tomato, turmeric, cumin, and salt. Cook till soft.
Add boiled peas and paneer. Add water as needed and simmer 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

title: Mushroom Jhol
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onion and ginger paste.
Add tomato, turmeric, cumin powder, and salt. Cook till oil separates.
Add potato and cook for 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and water. Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Mushroom Aloo Curry – Bihari Style
instructions: Heat mustard oil, add cumin seeds.
Add onion and ginger-garlic paste, sauté well.
Add turmeric, chili powder, salt, and mix.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and water. Simmer until vegetables are cooked.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Paneer Posto
instructions: Soak poppy seeds and grind with green chilies into a paste.
Heat mustard oil, fry paneer lightly and set aside.
Add posto paste, turmeric, and salt to the oil.
Cook the paste till oil separates.
Add paneer and a little water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Chanar Shorshe (Paneer Mustard Curry – Bengal)
instructions: Soak and grind mustard and poppy seeds with green chilies.
Lightly fry paneer in mustard oil and set aside.
Add paste to oil with turmeric and salt. Cook till raw smell goes.
Add water and bring to a simmer.
Add paneer and cook for 5–7 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Paneer Dalma (Fusion Style)
instructions: Boil dal with vegetables, salt, and turmeric until soft.
Fry paneer cubes until golden and set aside.
In a pan, heat ghee, add cumin and red chilies.
Add ginger paste and sauté briefly.
Mix dal-vegetable mixture, add paneer and coconut.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes. Serve with rice.

title: Dahi Paneer (Odisha Style Yogurt Paneer Curry)
instructions: Whisk yogurt with turmeric and salt.
Lightly fry paneer and set aside.
Heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds and green chili.
Lower heat, add yogurt and cook gently, stirring continuously.
Add paneer and simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Garnish and serve with rice.

title: Dim Kosha (Bengali Spicy Egg Curry)
instructions: Heat mustard oil and lightly fry the boiled eggs with a pinch of turmeric. Set aside.
In the same oil, sauté chopped onions till golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and cook till oil separates.
Add chopped tomato and cook until soft.
Add fried eggs and garam masala, mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Dim Jhol (Light Tomato Gravy Egg Curry – Bengali)
instructions: Fry boiled eggs and potatoes with a little turmeric. Set aside.
In mustard oil, sauté onion till soft. Add ginger paste.
Add turmeric, cumin powder, salt, and chopped tomato. Cook till soft.
Add fried eggs and potatoes with water. Simmer till potatoes are tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Anda Curry (Bihari Style)
instructions: Fry the eggs till golden and keep aside.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and tomato. Cook till oil separates.
Add fried eggs and garam masala. Cook for 5 minutes.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Egg Dalma (Odisha Fusion Curry)
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (pumpkin, ridge gourd, carrot)
instructions: Boil dal with vegetables, turmeric, and salt until soft.
Heat ghee, add cumin seeds and red chili.
Add the cooked dal mixture and grated coconut. Mix well.
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Dim Posto (Egg in Poppy Seed Gravy – Bengal)
instructions: Soak and grind poppy seeds with green chilies into a paste.
Fry boiled eggs lightly with turmeric. Set aside.
In mustard oil, cook the posto paste with turmeric and salt till oil separates.
Add eggs and water. Simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Egg Mustard Curry (Odisha Style)
instructions: Grind mustard seeds and green chili into a paste.
Fry boiled eggs in oil with turmeric. Set aside.
In same oil, cook mustard paste with turmeric and salt till raw smell goes.
Add water and bring to a simmer.
Add eggs and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with rice.

title: Egg Kalia (Rich Bengali Egg Curry)
instructions: Fry boiled eggs and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onion puree till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili, and cook.
Add tomato puree and yogurt, cook till oil separates.
Add eggs and garam masala, simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Serve with paratha or rice.

title: Dim Torkari (Rustic Egg Curry – Jharkhandi Style)
instructions: Fry eggs and potatoes with turmeric. Set aside.
Sauté onions in mustard oil till soft.
Add tomato, turmeric, cumin, and salt. Cook well.
Add eggs, potatoes, water and simmer till potatoes are tender.
Serve with rice or puri.

title: Anda Khar (Assamese Style)
ingredients: 1/4 tsp khar (alkaline water or filtered banana ash water)
instructions: Heat mustard oil, sauté green chili and grated papaya.
Add khar and salt. Mix well and cook till papaya is soft.
Add boiled eggs and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Dim Aloo Jhol (Egg Potato Curry – Bengal)
instructions: Fry eggs and potatoes with turmeric and set aside.
Sauté onion in mustard oil. Add ginger paste and cook.
Add tomato, turmeric, and salt. Cook till soft.
Add eggs, potatoes, water and simmer until potatoes are cooked.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Bengali Chicken Curry (Murgir Jhol)
instructions: Marinate chicken with salt and turmeric. Set aside.
Heat oil, fry potatoes till golden and set aside.
In same oil, sauté onions till golden, add ginger-garlic paste and fry.
Add tomato, spices and cook till oil separates.
Add chicken, fry on medium heat till sealed.
Add fried potatoes and water, simmer till chicken is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Chicken Kalia (Rich Festive Chicken – Bengal)
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, salt, and turmeric for 30 minutes.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onion puree till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, tomato puree and cook till oil separates.
Add chicken and cook until sealed and coated in masala.
Add water and simmer until chicken is tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve with paratha or pulao.

title: Chicken Kosha (Thick Masala Chicken)
instructions: Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, chili powder, cook till oil separates.
Add chicken and cook on low flame until meat is tender and masala thick.
Sprinkle garam masala, serve with luchi or paratha.

title: Odia Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with salt and turmeric.
Heat oil, sauté bay leaves and onions till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, and spices. Cook till oil separates.
Add chicken and fry till coated.
Add water and cook until chicken is tender.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Bihari Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with garlic paste, turmeric, and salt.
Heat mustard oil, splutter mustard seeds.
Add onions and sauté till golden.
Add marinated chicken, chili powder, and cook till browned.
Add water, cover and simmer till chicken is done.
Finish with garam masala. Serve with rice.

title: Jharkhand Chicken Curry
instructions: Marinate chicken with salt and turmeric.
Heat oil, fry onions till golden, add tomatoes and spices.
Add chicken and cook till well coated.
Add water and simmer till chicken is cooked.
Serve with rice or chapati.

title: Chicken Dak Bungalow Curry (Colonial Bengal Style)
instructions: Fry potatoes till golden and set aside.
In mustard oil, fry onions till golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato, turmeric and chilies.
Add chicken and fry till browned.
Add fried potatoes, water, and simmer till chicken is tender.
Add boiled eggs before serving. Garnish with garam masala.
Serve with rice.

title: Assamese Chicken Curry with Khar
instructions: Heat mustard oil, sauté onion and chili.
Add chicken, salt and fry till browned.
Add grated papaya and khar, cook with water till tender.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Chicken Curry with Mustard Paste (Odisha/Bengal)
instructions: Make a paste of mustard seeds and green chilies.
Heat mustard oil, fry onion and tomato till soft.
Add chicken and turmeric, cook till lightly browned.
Add mustard paste and water, simmer till chicken is cooked.
Serve with rice.

title: Chicken Potato Curry – Jharkhandi Style
instructions: Heat oil, fry potatoes till golden and set aside.
Sauté onion and tomato, add turmeric, cumin, and salt.
Add chicken and cook till sealed.
Add fried potatoes, water, and cook till everything is tender.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Bamboo Shoot Chicken (Assam)
instructions: Heat mustard oil in a pan and sauté onions and green chilies.
Add ginger paste and turmeric; cook for a minute.
Add chicken and fry till browned.
Add bamboo shoots and salt, mix well.
Add water, cover and simmer till chicken is tender.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Chicken Curry with Black Pepper – Odisha
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions till golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric and tomato. Cook till soft.
Add chicken and fry until sealed.
Add crushed black pepper and water.
Simmer till chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Kosha Mangsho (Slow-cooked Bengali Mutton)
instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt, salt, turmeric, and chili powder for 1 hour.
Heat mustard oil, fry onions till dark brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, cook for 2 minutes.
Add marinated mutton and cook on low heat for 45–60 minutes.
Add little water as needed and cook till tender.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve hot.

title: Odia Mutton Curry
instructions: Marinate mutton with turmeric and salt.
Heat mustard oil, sauté onions till golden.
Add garlic paste, tomatoes and chili powder. Cook till soft.
Add mutton and cook for 10 minutes.
Add water, cover and simmer till mutton is tender.
Add garam masala and serve with rice.

title: Bihari Mutton Curry
instructions: Marinate mutton with garlic paste, turmeric and salt.
Heat mustard oil, add mustard seeds, then sauté onions.
Add mutton, chili powder and cook till browned.
Add water, cover and simmer till mutton is soft.
Sprinkle garam masala and serve with rice or litti.

title: Mutton Saagwala (with Greens – Jharkhand)
ingredients: 2 cups spinach or mixed saag, chopped
instructions: Boil greens till soft, make a rough paste.
Heat oil, sauté onion, add garlic paste and turmeric.
Add mutton, cook till browned.
Add tomato and cook till soft.
Add saag paste and water, simmer till mutton is tender.
Serve with rice.

title: Mangsho Jhol (Light Gravy Mutton – Bengal)
instructions: Marinate mutton with turmeric and salt.
Fry potatoes till golden, set aside.
Sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add mutton, chili powder and cook till browned.
Add potatoes and water, simmer till tender.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Jharkhandi Mutton Masala
instructions: Marinate mutton with turmeric and salt.
Heat oil, sauté onions and garlic paste.
Add tomato and coriander powder, cook till soft.
Add mutton and cook till browned.
Add water, cover and cook till tender.
Finish with garam masala, serve hot.

title: Khasi Curry (Assamese Mutton Curry)
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions and green chilies.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric and black pepper.
Add Khasi meat and cook till browned.
Add water and cook until meat is soft and flavorful.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Mutton with Bamboo Shoot (Tribal Assam Style)
instructions: Heat mustard oil and sauté green chilies.
Add mutton, turmeric and salt, cook till browned.
Add bamboo shoots and water.
Cover and simmer until mutton is tender.
Serve with rice.

title: Macher Jhol (Classic Bengali Fish Curry)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Fry the fish pieces in mustard oil and set aside.
In the same oil, add cumin seeds and sauté potatoes till golden.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook till soft.
Add water to make a light curry and bring to boil.
Add fried fish and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Sorshe Ilish (Hilsa in Mustard Gravy – Bengal)
instructions: Grind mustard seeds with green chilies to a smooth paste.
Marinate hilsa with turmeric and salt.
Heat mustard oil till smoking, then reduce heat.
Add mustard paste and cook briefly.
Add water to form gravy and gently place fish pieces.
Simmer for 8-10 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Chingri Malai Curry (Prawns in Coconut – Bengal)
instructions: Clean and devein prawns, marinate with turmeric and salt.
Lightly fry prawns and set aside.
In the same oil, sauté onion and ginger paste.
Add coconut milk, salt, and bring to a boil.
Add prawns and simmer for 10 minutes.
Finish with garam masala and serve hot with rice.

title: Rui Macher Kalia (Rich Rohu Fish Curry)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt, fry until golden.
In the same oil, sauté onions, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, spices, and cook till oil separates.
Add water for gravy, boil and add fried fish.
Simmer for 8-10 minutes, finish with garam masala.
Serve hot with rice or pulao.

title: Macher Tok (Sour Tamarind Fish Curry)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt.
Fry fish pieces and set aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and green chilies.
Add tamarind pulp with water and bring to a boil.
Add fish pieces and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Serve tangy curry with rice.

title: Odia Fish Curry
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt, then fry.
Heat oil, sauté onions and garlic paste.
Add tomato, spices and cook till soft.
Add water and fried fish pieces.
Simmer for 10-12 minutes and serve with rice.

title: Fish Curry with Green Mango – Odisha
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt, fry and set aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and green chilies.
Add raw mango slices and water, boil till mango softens.
Add fried fish and simmer for 8 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Bihari Mustard Fish Curry
instructions: Make a paste of mustard seeds and green chilies.
Marinate fish with turmeric and salt, fry lightly.
Heat mustard oil, add mustard paste and water.
Add fish, simmer for 8-10 minutes.
Serve with plain rice.

title: Fish Curry with Khada Masala – Jharkhand
ingredients: 1 tsp whole garam masala (bay leaf, cardamom, cloves)
instructions: Marinate and fry fish with turmeric and salt.
Heat oil, sauté whole spices, then onion and garlic paste.
Add tomato and cook till soft.
Add water, bring to boil and add fish.
Simmer for 10 minutes, serve hot.

title: Prawn Curry with Spinach – Assam
instructions: Marinate prawns with turmeric and salt, fry lightly.
Heat oil, sauté onions and green chilies.
Add chopped spinach and cook till wilted.
Add prawns and a little water, simmer for 7-8 minutes.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Prawn Mustard Curry – Bengal
instructions: Soak mustard seeds for 15 minutes and grind with green chilies to a fine paste.
Marinate prawns with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
Heat mustard oil until smoking, reduce flame and fry prawns lightly. Remove and set aside.
In the same oil, add mustard-chili paste and fry for a minute.
Add water, bring to a boil and add prawns.
Simmer for 7–10 minutes until prawns are cooked through.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Assamese Fish Curry with Outenga (Elephant Apple)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt, then shallow fry and set aside.
Heat mustard oil and add mustard seeds until they splutter.
Add sliced outenga and green chilies, sauté for 3–4 minutes.
Add water and bring to a boil. Simmer until outenga softens.
Add fried fish and simmer for 8–10 minutes.
Serve hot with plain rice.
